tool.name: Larch Select Paths
tool.description: select FEFF paths for XAFS data

param.name: name
param.label: Name
param.help: The name of the variable should be unique, and can be used in expressions for other paths. If name is set, will overwrite the default bevaviour for this variable.

param.name: expr
param.label: Expression
param.help: If set, the variable will be 'Defined' by the expression. This can include other variable name, for example in order to set two paths to use the same variable.

param.name: vary
param.label: Vary
param.help: If True, the initial 'Guess' will be optimised in the fitting. If False, the value will be 'Set' instead and not optimised.

param.name: max_number
param.label: Maximum number of paths
param.help: Will select (up to) this many paths, ordered by ascending path length, subject to criteria below. If unset, will select all that meet the criteria.

param.name: max_path_length
param.label: Maximum path length
param.help: Exclude paths with lengths greater than this (expressed in Angstrom). If unset, will not restrict based on path length.

param.name: min_amplitude_ratio
param.label: Minimum amplitude ratio (%)
param.help: Exclude paths with a ratio below this ratio (expressed as a percentage). If unset, will not restrict based on amplitude ratio.

param.name: max_degeneracy
param.label: Maximum degeneracy
param.help: Exclude paths with degeneracy above this value. If unset, will not restrict based on degeneracy.

section.name: variables
section.title: GDS variable defaults
section.help: Define default values for variables in the EXAFS equation to use for the paths selected below.

param.name: is_common
param.label: Common to all paths
param.help: If set, a single variable 's02' will be used for all paths. Otherwise, each path has a distinct variable.

param.name: value
param.label: Value
param.help: The initial value for 's02'. This is typically between 0.7 and 1.0.

param.name: is_common
param.label: Common to all paths
param.help: If set, a single variable 'e0' will be used for all paths. Otherwise, each path has a distinct variable.

param.name: value
param.label: Value
param.help: The initial value for 'e0'. This should be close to zero, as it represents the difference in the absorption edge positions between simulation and experiment.

section.name: deltar
section.title: Delta R: change in path length

param.name: is_common
param.label: Common to all paths
param.help: If set, a single variable 'alpha*reff' will be used for all paths (where 'reff' is the effective path length). Otherwise, each path has a distinct variable.

param.name: value
param.label: Value
param.help: The initial value for 'alpha'. This should be close to zero, as it represents the difference in the FEFF path and fitted (experimental) path length.

param.name: is_common
param.label: Common to all paths
param.help: If set, a single variable 'sigma2' will be used for all paths. Otherwise, each path has a distinct variable.

param.name: value
param.label: Value
param.help: The initial value for 'sigma2'. This should be small, but non-zero, as atomic vibrations will result in variation in exact positions.

repeat.name: feff_outputs
repeat.title: Distinct FEFF outputs
repeat.help: If FEFF has been used on multiple structures, the paths from each can be merged into one input to provide to Larch Artemis. If only one entry is provided, then the zipped directory of paths will be unchanged.

param.name: label
param.label: Label
param.help: Short label to use when merging different FEFF outputs to ensure they remain distinct. Not required if only providing a single output, and will default to the index in this list.

param.name: paths_zip
param.label: Zipped paths directory
param.help: Zipped directory containing the actual path files output by FEFF.

param.name: paths_file
param.label: Paths file
param.help: CSV file detailing the possible scattering paths. Note that rows with '1' in the 'select' column will be selected with default values for their parameters automatically.

repeat.name: paths
repeat.title: Define path variables
repeat.help: Overwrite the default variables defined above for chosen paths.

param.name: id
param.label: Path ID
param.help: Numerical id of a path to select, this appears at the end of the label and filename in the path summary CSV.

param.name: value
param.label: Value
param.help: The initial value for 's02'. This is typically between 0.7 and 1.0.

param.name: value
param.label: Value
param.help: The initial value for 'e0'. This should be close to zero, as it represents the difference in the absorption edge positions between simulation and experiment.

section.title: Delta R: change in path length

param.name: value
param.label: Value
param.help: The initial value for 'alpha'. This should be close to zero, as it represents the difference in the FEFF path and fitted (experimental) path length.

param.name: value
param.label: Value
param.help: The initial value for 'sigma2'. This should be small, but non-zero, as atomic vibrations will result in variation in exact positions.

param.name: min_combination_size
param.label: Minimum combination size
param.help: Each combination will have at least this many paths. If less then this many paths match the below criteria, a single combination with all paths will be generated.

param.name: max_combination_size
param.label: Maximum combination size
param.help: Each combination will have at most this many paths. Note this is distinct from the number of paths to consider, below. One might want to consider combinations of the 5 shortest paths (set using 'Maximum number of paths'), but have no more than 3 paths in each combination (set using this).

repeat.title: Select paths
repeat.help: Identify paths to use in the fitting by their id, and optionally define their variables. This will overwrite and defaults set above.

param.help: The initial value for 'e0'. This should be close to zero, as it represents the difference in the absorption edge positions between simulation and experiment.

tool.help:
Select FEFF scattering paths to use in the fitting process.
If paths from multiple different FEFF outputs are of interest (for example, corresponding to different structural files), then additional FEFF outputs can be added. Each requires its own zip directory and path summary CSV, and any custom GDS parameters will be uniquely labelled with the label provided or a numerical default. In this case the zipped directories will also be merged into one output containing all paths and associated files.
If only one set of FEFF outputs is provided, labelling is not required and the existing zip file can be used as the input to Larch Artemis.
If the selection method "All paths" is chosen, or an individual row in the CSV with ``select`` is set to ``1``, it will be automatically used, with the default values defined. This can be useful when many paths are needed and using the UI can be cumbersome.
It is also possible to manually check and further modify the GDS and SP output CSVs to ensure the values are suitable, as an alternative to re-running this tool.
